Sentencas: Symmetrical solid oxide fuel cells (SSOFCs) are types of potential devices because of their simple structure, low cost, and high performance, but suffer from electrolyte-electrode interface degradation and lack of buffer layer materials.
Titulo: Enhancing performance and stability of symmetrical solid oxide fuel cells via quasi-symmetrical ceria-based buffer layers

Sentencas: Herein, we propose a new strategy of quasi-symmetrical ceria-based buffer layers on electrolyte for SSOFCs, which can enhance both performance and long-term stability of yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) fuel cells.
Titulo: Enhancing performance and stability of symmetrical solid oxide fuel cells via quasi-symmetrical ceria-based buffer layers

Sentencas: Three typical buffer layers of Gd0.2Ce0.8O2-delta (GDC), Sm0.2Ce0.8O2-delta (SDC), and Sm0.075Nd0.075Ce0.85O2-delta (SNDC) are fabricated on YSZ electrolyte by spin-coating method, the effects of which on electrochemical per-formance of fuel cells with Pr0.6Sr0.4FeO3-delta (PSF) electrode are investigated in detail.
Titulo: Enhancing performance and stability of symmetrical solid oxide fuel cells via quasi-symmetrical ceria-based buffer layers

Sentencas: It is surprising to find that when SNDC was applied as the buffer layer, it had the smallest polarization impedance (RP) of 0.189 omega cm2 at 800 degrees C in air; while SDC was utilized as the buffer layer, it possessed the smallest RP of 0.331 omega cm2 at 800 degrees C in H2.
Titulo: Enhancing performance and stability of symmetrical solid oxide fuel cells via quasi-symmetrical ceria-based buffer layers

Sentencas: The designed quasi-symmetrical (QS)-buffer layers of SNDC and SDC achieve the highest power density of 346.13 mW cm-2 at 800 degrees C.
Titulo: Enhancing performance and stability of symmetrical solid oxide fuel cells via quasi-symmetrical ceria-based buffer layers

Sentencas: In addition, SSOFC with a QS-buffer layer and no attenuation of current density at a consistent voltage of 0.7 V indicates promising application prospects.
Titulo: Enhancing performance and stability of symmetrical solid oxide fuel cells via quasi-symmetrical ceria-based buffer layers
